\nItems

\n\n
\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
\n
\n
\n\n\n

Items are an integral part of the gameplay of The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth. They modify Isaac\'s attributes, grant or modify tear effects, and much more.\n

Items are classified into several distinct types and groups. Some items are passive, which add an effect permanently to Isaac, while others only activate when used. The original The Binding of Isaac had 196 items. Rebirth has a total of 341 items. Afterbirth added 95 new items, for a total of 436 items. Afterbirth \xe2\x80\xa0 added 111 new items, for a total of 547 items. Repentance added 169 new items, for a total of 716 items. An update for Repentance, V1.7.5, added 3 new items, for a total of 719 items. In Afterbirth \xe2\x80\xa0 and prior, 13 items are considered special and will be less likely to appear if the player has already come across other special items. The Repentance expansion removed the Special Item mechanic, replacing it with the item weight and item quality mechanics.\n

For a list of which items can potentially appear in a given special room or under certain conditions, see item pool and Item Tags.\n

For the grids of items that appear in the stats menu, see Collection Page.\n

Not to be confused with cards and runes, pills, and trinkets.\n

\n

Contents

\n
    \n
  • 1 Activated Collectibles\n
      \n
    • 1.1 Notes
      • \n
    \n
    • \n
  • 2 Passive Collectibles
    • \n
  • 3 Collectible ID Gaps
    • \n
  • 4 Trivia
    • \n
\n
\n

Activated Collectibles[ | ]

\n

Unless the player has Schoolbag, only one activated item can be held at a time, with the old collectible being placed on a pedestal if a new activated item is picked up. Most activated items need to recharge before use, with the recharge bar filling either by clearing rooms or recharging over time. Other activated items do not have a charge bar, and, with a few exceptions (such as How to Jump), will instead either disappear after a single use or require resources such as coins or health. Some activated items will also grant passive effects as long as they are equipped.\n

In some special circumstances, activated items can be placed in the consumable slot instead of the standard activated item slot. This counts as both an extra activated item slot and an extra consumable slot, meaning that other activated items and consumables can be picked up as normal. Items in this slot are used with the consumable key, and can\'t be lost through any means (unless they\'re consumed like items from Dice Bag). Otherwise, they function the same as other activated items.\n

\n

Notes[ | ]

\n
  • Battery Bums and most Batteries charge the item(s) in the activated item slot first, then the item in the consumable slot. The exception to this is the Mega Battery, which recharges the items in both slots.
    • \n
  • Most trinkets that work with activated items (e.g. Vibrant Bulb, Panic Button, etc.) ignore the items in the consumable slot.
\n

\n

Passive Collectibles[ | ]

\n

Passive collectables are vast and diverse, varying wildly in effect and strength. Some simply improve Isaac\'s stats, add health, or provide a familiar. Some completely change the way the run can play.\n

\n
  • Other common effects include:\n
    • Isaac\'s tears gaining Tear effects or causing Status Effects on hitting enemies.
      • \n
    • Isaac\'s tears being replaced with a completely different weapon, such as a knife.
      • \n
    • Isaac\'s bombs gaining new effects, often with a bonus supply of extra bombs.
      • \n
    • Triggering a special effect when Isaac takes damage, or kills an enemy.
      • \n
    • Creating additional pickups, either when first collected, or over time.
      • \n
    • Improving active item cooldowns.
      • \n
    • Granting permanent flight.
\n

An unlimited amount of passive collectibles can be held at a time, and the effects they grant usually last until the end of that run.\n

\n
  • Removing a passive item is only possible in a few rare ways, and usually comes with severe drawbacks, such as D4 and Genesis rerolling all passive items, or Clicker removing the last passive item collected at the cost of changing the active character.
\n
  • Tainted Isaac is limited to 8 passive items (12 with Birthright) at a time, and can freely swap out old passive items once his inventory is full.
\n

Nearly all passive collectables alter Isaac\'s appearance when collected, with newer items replacing the cosmetic effects of older items.\n

Eye Sore\n5.100.558\n\nMore eyes\nCauses Isaac to occasionally fire extra tears in random directions while shooting.\n1\n
False PHD\n5.100.654\n\nWorse pills + evil up\nConverts good pills into bad pills and identifies all pills. Bad pills now have secondary positive effects. Grants one Black Heart.\n2\n
Freezer Baby\n5.100.608\n\nIced iced baby\nSpawns a shooting familiar that has a chance to petrify enemies, and freezes monsters upon killing them.\n2\n
Fruity Plum\n5.100.649\n\nBouncy friend\nGives Isaac a miniature Baby Plum familiar that propels itself diagonally around the room, firing tears behind itself as it travels.\n1\n
Ghost Bombs\n5.100.727\n\nSpooky blast +5 bombs\n+5 Bombs. Bombs become spectral and spawn ghosts that deal contact damage to enemies and explode after 10 seconds.\n2\n
Giant Cell\n5.100.658\n\nMicro friends\nCauses Isaac to spawn micro-Isaacs when he takes damage, which chase and shoot at nearby enemies.\n1\n
Glass Eye\n5.100.730\n\nDMG + luck up\n+0.75 damage, +1 luck.\n3\n
Glitched Crown\n5.100.689\n\n?????\nItem pedestals cycle between 5 random items before being picked up.\n4\n
Guppy\'s Eye\n5.100.665\n\nAn eye for secrets\nShows the contents of Chests, Fire Places, Grab Bags, and Shopkeepers before they\'re opened/destroyed.\n2\n
Heartbreak\n5.100.694\n\nEternal sorrow\nGrants 3 broken hearts and +0.25 damage for every broken heart Isaac has. Every otherwise fatal hit will add 2 more until Isaac has nothing but broken hearts.\n3\n
Hemoptysis\n5.100.726\n\nDouble tap sneeze\nDouble-tapping a fire button causes Isaac to sneeze blood, dealing damage to enemies in front of him. Affected enemies are cursed and take more damage from Brimstone-like attacks.\n1\n
Hungry Soul\n5.100.684\n\nOut for blood\nEnemies have a chance to spawn ghosts on death, which chase and deal contact damage to enemies and explode after a short time.\n2\n
Hypercoagulation\n5.100.724\n\nThick blooded\nAfter Isaac takes damage from an enemy or donates health, launches Red Hearts from Isaac that despawn after 1.5 seconds.\n2\n
IBS\n5.100.725\n\nYour stomach rumbles\nCauses Isaac to throw poop, create buffing creep, or drop bombs while fighting enemies.\n0\n
Immaculate Heart\n5.100.573\n\nHalo of tears\nAdds one Red Heart Container and fully restores health. x1.2 damage multiplier. Isaac will occasionally fire extra tears that orbit around him.\n3\n
Inner Child\n5.100.688\n\nLet him free\nUpon death, Isaac respawns in the current room with half of a Red Heart, a massive size down, and +0.2 Speed.\n2\n
Isaac\'s Tomb\n5.100.701\n\nBuried memories\nSpawns an Old Chest at the start of each floor.\n3\n
It Hurts\n5.100.560\n\nNo it doesn\'t...\nReleases a ring of tears and increases fire rate for the current room when Isaac takes damage.\n1\n
Jupiter\n5.100.594\n\nYou\'re a gas giant!\n+2 red Heart containers, -0.3 speed. Isaac builds speed while standing still, and releases poison gas clouds when he moves afterwards.\n2\n
Keeper\'s Kin\n5.100.717\n\nUnder a rock\nRocks and other Obstacles spawn blue spiders over time while in a room with enemies, and spawn two blue spiders when destroyed.\n2\n
Keeper\'s Sack\n5.100.716\n\nSpending power\nGives range, speed, or damage when buying things from a shop. Also spawns three coins and a Key on pickup.\n3\n
Knife Piece 1\n5.100.626\n\n???\nCombined with Knife Piece 2, creates a knife familiar that damages enemies and can open the door to the Corpse.\n0\n
Knife Piece 2\n5.100.627\n\n???\nCombined with Knife Piece 1, creates a knife familiar that damages enemies and can open the door to the Corpse.\n0\n
Knockout Drops\n5.100.637\n\nThey pack a punch!\nAdds a chance to shoot a fist tear that has extremely high knockback and confuses enemies.\n3\n
Lil Abaddon\n5.100.679\n\nAbyssal friend\nSpawns a familiar that charges a miniature Maw of the Void attack while Isaac shoots.\n2\n
Lil Dumpy\n5.100.615\n\nPuffy buddy\nSpawns a Dumpy familiar that pushes away nearby enemies and projectiles just before Isaac is about to be hit, then falls asleep. He can be awoken by walking to him.\n3\n
Lil Portal\n5.100.681\n\nIt hungers\nA familiar that flies forward, consuming pickups in its path. Each one will increase its size and damage and spawn a Blue Fly. Every four pickups, it opens a portal that leads to an unexplored room.\n1\n
Lodestone\n5.100.617\n\nMagnetizing tears\nGives Isaac the chance to fire tears that magnetize enemies they hit, causing them to attract nearby pickups and enemies, as well as tears/shots from all sources.\n3\n
Lost Soul\n5.100.612\n\nProtect him\nCreates a ghostly familiar that closely follows behind Isaac. It dies in one hit, but respawns at the start of the next floor. Each time it survives until the next floor, it rewards Isaac with Soul Hearts, Eternal Hearts, or an Item.\n2\n
Luna\n5.100.589\n\nThe moon\'s blessing shines upon you\nAdds an extra Secret Room and Super Secret Room to each floor. Secret Rooms contain a beam of light that increases Fire Rate for the current floor and gives a Half Soul Heart.\n2\n
Mars\n5.100.593\n\nDouble tap dash\nDash by double-tapping the movement key, becoming invulnerable and damaging enemies. There\'s a short cooldown before Isaac can dash again.\n2\n
Member Card\n5.100.602\n\nExclusive access!\nAdds a trapdoor to every Shop that leads to a second shop with a unique stock and marked-up prices.\n2\n
Mercurius\n5.100.590\n\nSpeed up + you feel elusive\n+0.4 speed. Doors stay open after entering a room, even in rooms with enemies.\n3\n
Mom\'s Ring\n5.100.732\n\nDMG up\n+1 Damage. Drops a random Rune or Soul Stone upon pickup.\n3\n
Monstrance\n5.100.574\n\nPurifying light\nIsaac gains an aura that deals damage to enemies inside it.\n2\n
Montezuma\'s Revenge\n5.100.680\n\nOh no...\nWhile firing, Isaac charges up a short-ranged Brimstone-like diarrhea beam that shoots behind him.\n2\n
Mucormycosis\n5.100.553\n\nSpore shot\nGives Isaac the chance to fire spore tears that stick to enemies and blow up after a few seconds, dealing damage and poisoning nearby enemies and releasing more spores.\n3\n
Nancy Bombs\n5.100.563\n\nRandom blast +5 bombs\n+5 Bombs. Each bomb gains 1-4 random bomb synergies.\n2\n
Neptunus\n5.100.597\n\nOpen the floodgates\nIsaac\'s mouth fills with tears over time while not firing, up to a cap. Holding the fire button will release all stored tears in rapid succession.\n3\n
Ocular Rift\n5.100.606\n\nStare into the abyss\nGives Isaac the chance to fire tears that create rifts where they land, which damage nearby enemies and pull in enemies, pickups, and tears/shots from all sources.\n3\n
Options?\n5.100.670\n\nThere might be options\nIf a room gives a reward when cleared, there will be two different rewards to chose from. Taking one causes the other to disappear.\n2\n
Orphan Socks\n5.100.571\n\nSpeed up + your feet feel stronger\nPrevents creep and floor spikes from damaging Isaac. Also gives Isaac +0.3 speed and 2 Soul Hearts.\n2\n
Paschal Candle\n5.100.567\n\nKeep the flame burning\nGives Isaac a familiar that grants +0.4 Fire Rate for each consecutive room he\'s cleared without taking damage. The bonus stacks up to five times.\n3\n
Playdough Cookie\n5.100.570\n\nTasty rainbow\nGrants multicolored tears. Each color comes with a different status or tear effect.\n2\n
Pluto\n5.100.598\n\nSize down\n+0.7 tears. Significantly shrinks Isaac, allowing him to squeeze between objects and makes some enemy shots pass over him.\n3\n
Psy Fly\n5.100.581\n\nFlamboyant protector\nSpawns a fly orbital familiar that chases and blocks enemy shots.\n4\n
Purgatory\n5.100.634\n\nHelp from beyond\nWhile in a room with enemies, spawns cracks on the ground. Walking over these cracks summons ghosts that launch themselves at enemies and explode.\n2\n
Quints\n5.100.661\n\nThey lurk inside\nThe first five enemies killed in a room will spawn stationary shooting familiars where they died.\n2\n
Red Stew\n5.100.621\n\nFull HP + temporary DMG up\nRefills all heart containers. Grants an enormous damage boost that wears off over time.\n2\n
Redemption\n5.100.673\n\nDeliver me from evil\nIf Isaac enters a Devil Room, but leaves without taking/opening anything in it (including Black Hearts, etc.), he gets +1 Damage and a Soul Heart at the start of the next floor.\n2\n
Revelation\n5.100.643\n\nAwaken your faith\nGrants flight and two Soul Hearts. In addition to tears, Isaac can charge up and fire a powerful holy laser.\n4\n
Rock Bottom\n5.100.562\n\nIt\'s only up from there\nLocks Isaac\'s attributes to their highest values reached.\n3\n
Rocket in a Jar\n5.100.583\n\nRocket propulsion +5 bombs\n+5 Bombs. If Isaac is currently firing, placing a bomb will instead shoot a fast-moving, explosive rocket in the direction he\'s facing.\n2\n
Rotten Tomato\n5.100.618\n\nDelicious!\nAdds a chance to fire tears that mark enemies with the Bait status effect. Enemies marked as bait are attacked by other enemies.\n2\n
Sacred Orb\n5.100.691\n\nDestined for greatness\nPrevents items of quality 0-1 from appearing, and items of quality 2 from appearing 33% of the time, greatly increasing the quality of items received from all item pools. Quest items are unaffected.\n4\n
Salvation\n5.100.696\n\nDivine protection\nGives Isaac a halo that summons beams of light on enemies inside it. The halo grows larger the more times Isaac has taken damage this floor.\n3\n
Sanguine Bond\n5.100.692\n\nHe awaits your offering\nSpawns a special set of spikes in the Devil Room. Taking damage from the spikes has a chance to grant a reward.\n1\n
Saturnus\n5.100.595\n\nRing of tears\nUpon entering a room, a circle of tears orbits Isaac. Enemy tears have a chance to be caught in orbit, turning them friendly.\n2\n
Sausage\n5.100.669\n\nAll stats up\nAdds a Red Heart Container, fully heals Isaac, and gives +0.2 Speed, +0.5 Damage, +0.5 Tears, +2.5 Range, +0.2 Shot Speed, and +1.0 Luck. Increases the chance of encountering a Devil Room, Angel Room, and/or Planetarium each by 6.9%.\n3\n
Sol\n5.100.588\n\nRadiant victory\nReveals the location of the Boss Room. Upon defeating a boss, activates XIX - The Sun, fully recharges Isaac\'s active item, grants bonus damage and luck for the rest of the floor, and removes curses.\n2\n
Soul Locket\n5.100.686\n\nPower of faith\nGives Isaac a permanent stat boost whenever he picks up a Soul Heart.\n1\n
Spirit Shackles\n5.100.674\n\nUnfinished business\nOn death, Isaac\'s ghost is chained to his dead body and he can continue to fight with 1/2 of a heart, returning to life after 10 seconds. After it activates, it must be recharged by picking up a Soul Heart.\n2\n
Spirit Sword\n5.100.579\n\nDivine blade\nInstead of tears, Isaac swings a sword. Charging does a spin attack and fires a projectile, and a projectile is sometimes fired with normal swings if Isaac has no empty Red Heart Containers.\n3\n
Stapler\n5.100.708\n\nDMG up\n+1 Damage. Prevents Isaac from firing tears from his left eye, like Cain.\n3\n
Star of Bethlehem\n5.100.651\n\nFollow the light\nSpawns a star familiar that slowly travels towards the Boss Room, giving an aura that increases damage and tears and grants homing tears.\n3\n
Strawman\n5.100.667\n\nA helping hand\nSpawns a controllable Keeper to fight enemies alongside Isaac, functioning similarly to Jacob and Esau. If Keeper dies, he spawns 5 blue spiders and Strawman is removed from Isaac\'s inventory.\n2\n
Stye\n5.100.731\n\nDMG + range up\nTears fired from Isaac\'s right eye have +28% Damage, +6.5 Range, and -0.3 Shot Speed.\n2\n
Supper\n5.100.707\n\nHP up\nGrants one full Red Heart container. Heals 1 additional Red Heart.\n1\n
Terra\n5.100.592\n\nBorn to rock\n+1 Damage. Replaces tears with rocks that deal variable damage, have increased knockback, and can destroy obstacles.\n3\n
The Intruder\n5.100.575\n\nInvasive friend\nA familiar burrows in Isaac\'s head, firing 4 slowing tears. Upon taking damage, there\'s a chance it will burst out of Isaac\'s head, spawning blue spiders and chasing enemies for the current room.\n3\n
The Stairway\n5.100.586\n\nMay you get what you came for\nGenerates a ladder at the start of every floor that leads to a unique Angel Room shop.\n3\n
The Swarm\n5.100.693\n\nInfest\nSpawns eight orbital flies, which turn into Blue Flies after they block a shot. Each time a room is cleared, spawns another orbital fly.\n2\n
Tinytoma\n5.100.645\n\nItching for revenge\nGives Isaac a Teratoma orbital that blocks shots, deals contact damage, and splits into smaller versions of itself upon taking damage. The smaller versions break into blue spiders.\n1\n
TMTRAINER\n5.100.721\n\nZZaZZ ZZdZZiZZmZZhZZ ZZvZZ ZZoZZ ZZ ZZsZZlZZhZZsZZoZZaZZiZZ\nCauses all future items to be "glitched", granting them completely random effects.\n0\n
Tooth and Nail\n5.100.663\n\nYou feel prickly\nIsaac periodically turns into a spiked statue, briefly becoming invulnerable and dealing contact damage.\n2\n
Tropicamide\n5.100.659\n\nTear size + range up\n+2.5 Range, Increases tear size.\n1\n
Twisted Pair\n5.100.698\n\nDouble trouble!\nSpawns two familiars that float on either side of Isaac and fire tears that use his tears, range, shot speed, and tear effects, and scale with damage.\n4\n
Uranus\n5.100.596\n\nIce tears\nIsaac shoots ice tears, which slow enemies and freeze monsters they kill. Frozen enemies slide away and explode into ice shards when touched.\n3\n
Vanishing Twin\n5.100.697\n\nHe wants revenge\nSpawns a familiar that becomes a clone of the floor\'s boss when entering the Boss Room. Defeating it drops an extra item.\n2\n
Vasculitis\n5.100.657\n\nClogged enemies\nEnemies explode into tears upon death, which inherit the effects of Isaac\'s tears.\n1\n
Vengeful Spirit\n5.100.702\n\nHot blooded\nAfter taking damage, spawns an orbital wisp that lasts for the entire floor, up to a maximum of six. They fire tears but do not block shots.\n1\n
Venus\n5.100.591\n\nHP up + you feel pretty\nAdds one red Heart container. Heals 1 additional Red Heart. Enemies near Isaac become charmed.\n2\n
Voodoo Head\n5.100.599\n\nExtra curse rooms\nSpawns an additional Curse Room on each floor. Curse Rooms have improved layouts.\n2\n
Worm Friend\n5.100.682\n\nClingy buddy\nGives Isaac a Nerve Ending familiar that burrows out of the ground to grab and deal damage to enemies over time.\n3\n
Tonsil\n5.100.474\n\nGross...\nGrants a familiar that follows Isaac and blocks enemy shots.\n\n

Collectible ID Gaps[ | ]

\n

All of the collectibles in the game have contiguous IDs, with the following exceptions:\n

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
ID\nDescription\nItem Before\nItem After\n
43\nHas a placeholder name of "Pills here!" in the "items.xml" file, a leftover from the original The Binding of Isaac.\nBob\'s Rotten Head (42)\nTeleport! (44)\n
59\n The passive version of The Book of Belial granted when obtaining Birthright as Judas or Dark Judas.\nBook of Shadows (58)\nThe Ladder (60)\n
61\nHas a placeholder name of "Tarot Card" in the "items.xml" file, a leftover from the original The Binding of Isaac.\nThe Ladder (60)\nCharm of the Vampire (62)\n
235\nn/a\nInfestation 2 (234)\nE. Coli (236)\n
263\nClear Rune was reallocated to this ID in Repentance.\nMissing Page 2 (262)\nSmart Fly (264)\n
587\nUsed to be the ID for Menorah before it was cut from Repentance.\nThe Stairway (586)\nSol (588)\n
613\nUsed to be the ID for Salt Shaker before it was cut from Repentance.\nLost Soul (612)\nBlood Bombs (614)\n
620\nUsed to be the ID for Voodoo Pin before it was cut from Repentance.\nBirthright (619)\nRed Stew (621)\n
630\nUsed to be the ID for Lucky Seven before it was cut from Repentance.\nBot Fly (629)\nMeat Cleaver (631)\n
648\nUsed to be the ID for Pill Crusher before it was cut from Repentance.\n4.5 Volt (647)\nFruity Plum (649)\n
656\nA passive collectible granted when you use the Damocles active item. Since it is not a "real" item, it is included in this list of missing IDs.\nSpin to Win (655)\nVasculitis (657)\n
662\nn/a\nQuints (661)\nTooth and Nail (663)\n
666\nn/a\nGuppy\'s Eye (665)\nStrawman (667)\n
718\nn/a\nKeeper\'s Kin (717)\nKeeper\'s Box (719)\n

Trivia[ | ]

\n
  • Wiggle Worm was an item in the original The Binding of Isaac; however, in Rebirth, it was changed into a trinket.\n
    • The Polaroid was a trinket in the original The Binding of Isaac, but was changed into an item. Interestingly, these changes keep the count of items and trinkets from the original game the same.
    • \n
  • There are a total of 170 active items, with 74 in Rebirth, 19 in Afterbirth, 30 in Afterbirth+, and 47 in Repentance. Of those, 138 items utilize a charge bar, with 61 items in Rebirth, 16 in Afterbirth, 24 in Afterbirth+, and 37 in Repentance.
    • \n
  • There are a total of 547 passive items, with 267 in Rebirth, 76 in Afterbirth, 81 in Afterbirth+, and 123 in Repentance.\n
    • From Rebirth to Afterbirth+, there has been about a 1:4 ratio of active items to passive items.
    • \n
  • Afterbirth+\'s original item count was 89. The Booster Packs added 42 items.
\n
